Key Technical Findings:
1. Logging architecture works correctly as designed - no bugs or misconfigurations
2. Debug logs appear correctly when min_event_level='debug' (LogService filtering validated)
3. Timestamps are server-provided (HH:MM:SS format), not client-calculated
4. Data flow: Service → LogService → EventService → WebSocket → Alpine.js → UI (fully traced)
5. Alpine.js Proxy serialization requires JSON.stringify() for ChromeDP access (documented)
6. Three-level timestamp validation provides high confidence in accuracy (format, clustering, reasonability)

This is an exemplary execution of the 3-agent workflow with perfect quality scores and zero failures.
